newsitem.title: USA: Electronic Arts Q3 net rises 25 percent.
newsitem.headline: Electronic Arts Q3 net rises 25 percent.

text.p: Electronic Arts Inc said Thursday its fiscal third-quarter net income rose 25 percent, slightly better than Wall Street expected, on strong sales of its video games during Christmas.

The biggest U.S. developer of video game software said net income for the quarter ended December 31 rose to $36.7 million, or $0.66 a share, from $29.3 million, or $0.54, in the same quarter a year ago.
Third-quarter revenue rose 13 percent to $271.1 million from $240.1 million a year ago.
Wall Street expected Electronic Arts, based in San Mateo, Calif., to earn 65 cents, according to a recent survey by First Call.
Electronic Arts said strong sales of new products for the Sony PlayStation video game console and personal computers contributed to the increase.
PlayStation and PC games largely offset a 53 percent decline in sales for older Sega and Nintendo game machines, the company said.
